supporting_text: The NAP adopts a One Health approach by integrating human health, animal health, and environmental considerations.
The NAP outlines specific strategies aimed at improving human health outcomes related to AMR.
The NAP includes actions focused on animal health, particularly in relation to antibiotic use in livestock.
The NAP addresses environmental factors contributing to AMR, including waste management and pollution control.
The NAP includes strategies aimed at promoting safe agricultural practices to mitigate AMR risks.
The NAP specifies the establishment of a monitoring framework to report on progress annually.
The NAP sets specific targets with deadlines for various AMR-related initiatives.
The NAP includes quantitative targets for reducing AMR prevalence and monitoring antimicrobial use.
The NAP outlines budget allocations for various AMR initiatives.
The NAP includes an assessment of future budget needs for implementing its strategies.
The NAP establishes a multisectoral task force to coordinate AMR activities across sectors.
The NAP includes actions aimed at enhancing the legislative framework governing antimicrobial use.
The NAP outlines educational initiatives to raise awareness about AMR in medical and veterinary training.
The NAP includes plans for public awareness campaigns to educate the community about AMR.
The NAP emphasizes the importance of international collaboration with organizations like WHO and FAO.
The NAP includes strategies for enhancing data collection and surveillance systems for AMR.
The NAP outlines actions to strengthen capacity for detecting and reporting new resistance patterns.
The NAP includes specific strategies for improving sanitation and infection prevention measures.
The NAP commits to implementing international standards for AMR control.
The NAP includes regulations for the distribution and prescription of antibiotics.
The NAP emphasizes the need for regulations to ensure the rational use of antibiotics.
The NAP includes actions to engage in international research collaborations for AMR solutions.
